Kdo bo plačal za stare grehe?
01 Nov 2019, 11:00 by Boris Blaić



Novembra se bo na sodišču začela pravna bitka za Tanjino hišo.Foto: B. B.



Zaradi dejanj nekdanjega moža bi Tanja lahko izgubila dom v Občicah.Foto: družinski arhiv


Novo mesto, Občice - »Rada bi, da mene in moje otroke pustijo pri miru. S celo zadevo nimam nič, zdaj pa mi grozijo, da mi bodo vzeli hišo,« nam je pred dnevi potožila gospa Tanja iz Občic. Javno se ne želi izpostavljati, a ne moremo mimo dejstva, da je bila še pred šestimi leti poročena z Romanom Križetom, ki je konec leta 2013 »zaslovel« z ugrabitvijo natakarice iz lokala v okolici Dolenjskih Toplic.
Kot se je pokazalo v postopku, je Križe natakarici dve leti zaman izkazoval ljubezen, nato pa ji je nekega večera v oktobru 2013, ko je končala z delom, zagrozil s pištolo in jo v njenem avtu odpeljal na njen dom. Natakarici je od tam nekako uspelo pobegniti in ko so policisti nato prišli k njej domov, so tam našli spečega Križeta. Zadeva se je precej časa vlekla po sodiščih, na koncu pa je bil Križe pravnomočno obsojen za protipraven odvzem prostosti in nasilništvo. Kasneje je ugrabljena natakarica zaradi pretrpljenega strahu in posledic proti Križetu vložila še odškodninsko tožbo, v kateri ji je sodišče prisodilo dobrih 10.000 evrov. »Poleg tega ji mora Križe povrniti še stroške pravdnega in kazenskega postopka, kar vse skupaj presega 16.000 evrov,« pojasnjuje njen odvetnik Matjaž Medle.
A zapletlo se je pri plačilu odškodnine. Križe, ki je po dogodku ostal brez službe, denarja za plačilo namreč nima, premoženja pa tudi ne, saj je hiša, v kateri je nekoč prebival, po ločitvi pristala v lastni Tanje. »Ločila sva se, še preden se je proti njemu začel sodni postopek. Tudi tega nisva vedela, da bo natakarica poroti njemu sprožila odškodninski postopek. Premoženje sva razdelila tako, da je njemu ostalo nekaj travnikov in ena njiva, jaz pa sem zaradi otrok, ki sta bila takrat še oba mladoletna, dobila hišo,« pripoveduje Tanja.
Nepremičnine, ki so pripadle Križetu, kake posebne vrednosti očitno nimajo, saj je ugrabljena natakarica preko svojega pooblaščenca lani vložila tožbo za razveljavitev pravnega posla, s katerim je Tanja ob razvezi postala lastnica hiše v Občicah. Z odvetnikom sta prepričana, da sta se Tanja in Roman namerno ločila, da bi na tak način zavarovala premoženje. »Sporazum o delitvi skupnega premoženja je bil po naši oceni sklenjen ravno zato, da se Križe izogne plačilu obveznosti do moje stranke. Dejstvo je namreč, da oba še vedno živita skupaj in da je bila Križetova nekdanja žena prisotna na praktično vseh kazenskih obravnavah, kar kaže na to, da je prišlo samo do formalnega prenehanja njune zakonske skupnosti,« pravi odvetnik Medle.
Tanja priznava, da Roman v resnici še vedno živi prav blizu, v nekdanjem gospodarskem objektu pri hiši, ki je zdaj preurejen v stanovanje. »Res je, med sojenjem sem mu stala ob strani, kaj pa naj, oče mojih otrok je in to je tudi njegova rojstna hiša, ne morem ga kar tako vreči na cesto,« pravi Tanja in dodaja, da je bila hiša v Občicah, ki je iz leta 1828, nekoč res last Romanove družine, a da sta jo po poroki leta 1995 začela obnavljati z lastnimi sredstvi, pri tem pa je z delom in materialom veliko pomagal tudi njen oče, ki je bil zidar.
Tanja je pred dnevi s sodišča dobila vabilo, da jo prva obravnava glede lastništva hiše čaka že v začetku novembra. Lani sta z odvetnikom, ki si ga zdaj ne more več privoščiti, saj je že tri mesece brez dela, spisala predlog za prekinitev pravdnega postopka. Dolgo časa ni bilo nobenega odgovora, zato je že mislila, da je njena prošnja uslišana. A kot kaže, ne bo šlo tako preprosto.
»Jezna, šokirana in užaljena sem bila, ko sem dobila vabilo na sodišče. Kaj imam jaz s tem, kar je naredil bivši mož? Nič! Zdaj pa mi grozi, da bova s hčerko ostali brez strehe nad glavo,« je obupana Tanja.
text:
Who will pay for the old sins?
01 Nov 2019, 11:00 by Boris Blaic



A legal battle for Tanja's house will begin in court in November.Photo: B.B.



Due to the actions of her ex-husband, Tanja could lose her home in Občice.Photo: Family Archive


Novo mesto, Občice - “They would like to leave me and my children alone. I have nothing to do with the whole thing, but now they threaten to take my house, ”Mrs. Tanja from Občice told us days ago. She does not want to expose herself to the public, but one cannot help but mention the fact that she was married six years ago to Roman Krizet, who at the end of 2013 "became famous" by abducting a waitress from a shop near Dolenjske Toplice.
As it turned out in the proceedings, Križe waited for the waitress for two years in love, and then, one evening in October 2013, when she finished working, he threatened her with a gun and took her to her home in her car. The waitress somehow managed to escape and when the officers then came to her home, they found a sleeping Krizet there. The case dragged on for a long time in the courts, and finally, Križe was finally convicted of unlawful arrest and violence. Later, the abducted waitress filed a lawsuit for suffering and the consequences against Krizet, in which the court awarded her more than 10,000 euros. "In addition, Križe has to reimburse her for litigation and criminal proceedings, which in total exceeds € 16,000," explains her lawyer, Matjaž Medle.
But it was complicated to pay compensation. Kriz, who lost his job after the event, has no money to pay, and no assets, since the house where he once resided after his separation landed in his own Tanja. “We separated before the legal proceedings were initiated against him. Also, we did not know that the waitress of the jury would initiate damages proceedings for him. We divided the property so that it left some meadows and one field, and because of the children, who were both underage at the time, I got the house, "Tanja says.
The real estate, which belonged to Krizet, clearly has no special value, since the abducted waitress, through her proxy, filed a lawsuit last year to cancel the legal transaction that made Tanja the owner of the house in Občice. She and the lawyer are convinced that Tanja and Roman have deliberately separated in order to protect their property in this way. “In our estimation, the agreement on the division of common assets was concluded precisely in order to avoid the cross payment of obligations to my client. The fact is that the two are still living together and that Krizet's ex-wife was present at practically all the criminal hearings, which indicates that only the formal dissolution of their marital community occurred, "says lawyer Medle.
Tanja admits that Roman is in fact still living very close to the former outbuilding of the house, which has now been converted into an apartment. "It is true, during the trial I stood by his side, what if he was the father of my children and this is his birthplace, I can't just throw him on the road," says Tanja, adding that the house was in Občice, which, dating from 1828, was once the property of Roman's family, but after her marriage in 1995, she began to renovate it with her own resources, and her father, who was a bricklayer, helped a lot with the work and materials.
A few days ago, Tanja received an invitation from the court to have her first hearing on the ownership of the house already in early November. Last year, she and her lawyer, who can no longer afford it, having been out of work for three months, wrote a motion to stay the civil proceedings. There was no answer for a long time, so she already thought her request was heard. But it doesn't seem that easy.
“I was angry, shocked and offended when I got the summons to court. What do I have to do with what my ex-husband did? Nothing! Now, I am threatening to have my daughter and I without a roof over our heads, "Tanja is desperate.
